Package com.astondevs.yanizamovramil.lessons.lesson_000.homework

Class MyArrayList<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.astondevs.yanizamovramil.lessons.lesson_000.homework.MyArrayList<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - the type parameter.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    MyList<E>
    public class MyArrayList<E>
extends java.lang.Object
implements MyList<E>
    The type My array list - is the collection implementation instead of standard ArrayList. Provides collection methods for adding, getting removing and sorting operations on its elements. Max size of collection elements provided is appointed as Integer.MAX_VALUE - 8.
    Author:
    Ramil Nizamov

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      MyArrayList()
      Instantiates a new My array list instance with default elements capacity.
      MyArrayList​(int capacity)
      Instantiates a new My array list instance with specified elements capacity.

      Clears all data in collection and sets all its properties to default values.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MyArrayList

        public MyArrayList()
        Instantiates a new My array list instance with default elements capacity.

      • MyArrayList

        public MyArrayList​(int capacity)
        Instantiates a new My array list instance with specified elements capacity.
        Parameters:
        capacity - the initial capacity of collection to be set. Min value must be bigger than or equal to 0, max value must be less than or equal to Integer.MAX_VALUE - 8.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if specified capacity value does not match its min and max limits.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public boolean add​(E e)
        Adding element to collection by order.
        Specified by:
        add in interface MyList<E>
        Parameters:
        e - element to be added to collection.
        Returns:
        true - if element e added, false - if element e is null, so element e could not be added.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if max size of elements in MyArrayList instance has been reached, so element e could not be added.

      • add

        public boolean add​(int index,
                   E e)
        Adding element to collection at index number, saving order of other elements.
        Specified by:
        add in interface MyList<E>
        Parameters:
        index - the index number, where element e assumed to add.
        e - element to be added to collection.
        Returns:
        true - if element e added, false - if element e is null, so element e could not be added.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if instance storage elements max capacity has been reached, so element e could not be added.
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index number is negative or bigger by 2 than last element index.

        Getting of element e stored at index number.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        index - the index number, whose element e assumed to get.
        Returns:
        element e stored at index number
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is negative number or bigger than the index of last element in collection
